summary:
As a product manager in a CivicTech startup, I am passionate about driving social impact through our digital engagement platform.

I have worked closely with our developers, designers and stakeholders to deliver our engagement SaaS, which enables purpose-driven organizations to open dialogues with their community in a safe environment. I have implemented a user-centered approach and processes, that include leading user research to ensure that our platform meets our clients' and users' needs. Together with the product team and through my strategic vision, we developed multiple projects that have increased user engagement and satisfaction.

As a law graduate with a strong background in the public sector, I am particularly drawn to projects with social impact and public interest. Leveraging my legal expertise, I have also played a key role in implementing privacy and data protection in a tech startup.

I am a proactive problem-solver, known for my ability to navigate complex challenges and drive successful outcomes. I am constantly seeking new ways to innovate and improve, and I am committed to making a positive impact in the world through my work.
headline: Product Manager | Social impact & B2G | Data privacy nerd 🔐 Law graduate

experience.description:
Since 2015, Civocracy has been empowering purpose-driven organizations to drive change through inclusive community engagement with their B2B SaaS. Civocracy vision is to foster engagement that leads to meaningful change.

• Built PM-Tech Lead partnership to drive together the product vision
• Prioritize our solutions based on collaborative methods, market analysis and some frameworks.
• Define and monitor metrics for each project with Amplitude & Matomo analytics
• Gather and analyse customer feedback and lead product discovery (customer jobs interview 😍)
• Adapt Agile methods to work in harmony with our team of 3 developers and designer (Light-Scrum, Kanban).
experience.title: Product Manager

experience.description:
Leveraging my experience working with public organizations as a purchasor, I developed strong relationships with local governments on the French public market.

• Lead the full account management cycle for the French market: product demoing, closing and re-signing (Retention rate 95%)
• Implement SaaS solution for new clients, most entities in the public sector (10+ cities portfolio)
• Facilitate customer success by providing support on project strategy and success metrics, along with regular feedback reports.
• Provide on-site and online training for software onboarding and digital participation best practices.

Data Privacy regulation: Ensure data privacy training and advise teams across the company on legal and regulatory matters (GDPR compliance, calls for tender, commercial).
experience.title: Account manager Public market

experience.description:
As a public procurement manager, I closely collaborated with the director in charge to oversee the procurement process for the regional public health organization with 300 employees.
This involved setting up the annual procurement plan, understanding the needs of each department, drafting specifications, launching tenders, and analyzing applicants' technical and financial offers.
Additionally, I provided legal consultations for business law and human resources, and ensured compliance with European and French rules on public procurement.
experience.title: Public procurement manager

experience.description:
As a legal advisor in the public procurement division, I provided guidance and support to the 50 purchasers of the SNCF's largest French purchasing group. 
In this role, I was responsible for drafting contracts, offering legal consultations on purchases of services, common supplies, and construction, and designing legal training programs for purchasers. 
My work helped ensure that procurement activities were conducted in compliance with legal requirements and industry best practices.
experience.title: Legal Counsel - EU & FR public procurement

experience.description:
As a public purchaser intern for the Paris City Hall, I was responsible for preparing and writing bidding documents for various communication and events procurements, including Bastille Day celebrations, Paris Plage, and exhibitions. 
I also played a role in the finalization of contract and pricing negotiations with the applicants. 
In addition, I worked closely with different departments and stakeholders to gather their needs and coordinate their input, ensuring that each call for tender was well-formulated and aligned with the City's goals.
experience.title: Public purchaser intern

education.fieldOfStudy: Public real estate law & public contract
